ygData.title: lgbt-india
ygData.description:
LGBT-India is the country's primary online networking, activism and discussion forum for lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender issues in the sub-continent.

History: The LGBT India collective was formed at the Yaariyan conference held in Hyderabad on Valentine's Day (Feb 14) 1999. It was initially called LGBT_India and hosted on egroups.com. Members of LGBT India also helped organize India's first Pride walk on July 2, 1999, in Kolkata.

Who can participate: LGBT-India is intended to be an inclusive group for lesbians, bisexuals, gays, kothis, hijras, double-deckers, transgender, intersex, genderfluid, asexual, and other queer people in India. People belonging to other sexuality/gender/sexual minorities as well as non-queer allies are welcome.

NOTE: Views expressed on this list do not reflect opinions of the moderators, and should not be construed as representative of the majority opinion of the diverse lesbian, gay, bi and transgender communities. Content from this list may not be cited or quoted in print media or on non-LGBT internet forums without express permission of the moderators.

Contact lgbt-india-owner@yahoogroups.com for more information
